website_summaries.verdict: A premium option for cutting tiles of different materials such as porcelain and ceramics.
pros: Capable of cutting 27 inches in length and 20 inches diagonally for tricky, oddly shaped walls
Wide base has heavy-duty rubber pads
Large handle makes it easy to apply consistent pressure during use
cons: Known to leave a small "tail" on some cuts that may require further cutting/grinding

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! We have tiled before, and used a similar, smaller cutter, which worked well. Bought this one because we are doing a large tile job, with porcelain tile. Breaks everyone, leaves a "tail" on some cuts, on others breaks clean for 10 inches, then breaks all the way across. Tested on many settings. Went back to 30 dollar cutter, and no problems. Don't buy!!! Wish I could return this expensive mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Simple, and Cuts Great
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and cuts porcelain tile like a dream. I bought one for the tile work on a master bath remodel and it really made quick work of all the cuts on the 12x24 porcelain tiles. I compared it to other units in the big box stores and this is much better built than comparably priced units.

customer_reviews.title: Best for ceramic 15in or less (porcelain can be very tricky to cut)
customer_reviews.text: This cutter is not great with porcelain as it cannot handle anything over 15in in length no matter how many times you score it carefully. Cuts between 12-15in work fine as long as you score it several times before engaging the snapping arm.

product_meta.title: QEP 10800 28-Inch Rip and 20-Inch Diagonal Professional Porcelain Tile Cutter with 7/8-Inch Cutting Wheel
product_meta.description: Size:1-(Pack)The QEP 10800 Professional Tile Cutter is a multi-purpose cutter for most ceramic and porcelain tile up to 28 inches in length. This cutter has Ishii engineering with a wide cast aluminum alloy base with heavy rubber pads for cutting stability, dual chrome-plated rail bars and linear ball bearing slides for smooth scoring. The 7/8 inch titanium-coated tungsten-carbide ball bearing cutting wheel is designed for long lasting performance even when scoring hard porcelain tiles. The wheel is adjustable to 4 different heights to move out of the way and allow easy snapping. The large, high-leverage bicycle grip handle makes repeat cutting easier and reduces fatigue. The base includes side arm extensions to support large format tiles.
feature_bullets: Cuts porcelain and ceramic floor and wall tile up to 28 in. or up to 20 in. tile diagonally, 5/8 in. thick
Wide, die-cast aluminum alloy base with heavy-duty rubber pads
Equipped with a replaceable 7/8 in. Titanium-Coated tungsten carbide cutting wheel
Linear ball bearing slides for smooth scoring
Large, high-leverage bicycle grip handle making cutting easier and reduces fatigue
Replace dull scoring wheels with QEP model 21123 (sold separately)
